creator: junk@pachikov.com
text:
even apachectl configtest returned nothing but 'Syntax OK' but apache refused to
start with or without ssl. No error reported, but the problem (after hours of
debug) turned out to be a small error in the path to the error_log file with-in
a virtual host.

this can be a serious problem, since there is not way to effectively verify all
the path in the httpd.conf file. I think it will be a great feature to add to
the configtest function.

For what it is worth, httpd-2.0+ reports an error in this case with the name of the bad log file.  It might be possible to backport this from 2.0 to 1.3.  If you'd like to do so, please discuss this on the development mailing list (dev@httpd.apache.org).

Thanks for using Apache HTTP Server!
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org
